comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
When using any powershell NuGet packages prior to beta.3, you need to read the instructions in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/2d06c17093f8ce7805e24e83f86925275aa038f0/docs/host-powershell/README.md, and if you read it, you will know there are samples already 😄 see here:
- [sample-dotnet1.1](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/2d06c17093f8ce7805e24e83f86925275aa038f0/docs/host-powershell/sample-dotnet1.1)
- [sample-dotnet2.0-powershell.beta1](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/2d06c17093f8ce7805e24e83f86925275aa038f0/docs/host-powershell/sample-dotnet2.0-powershell.beta.1)

The beta.3 packages will make hosting story the same as on Full CLR.

As for NuGet packages, you can just reference to Microsoft.Powershell.SDK and Microsoft.Powershell.Commands.Diagnostics, the former package will pull in the rest packages.
